content.div:
Nick Cannon may have fully recovered from his kidney failure from earlier this year -- but the radio host isn't out of the woods yet when it comes to his health.

It looks like Mr. Mariah Carey is going to have to put the brakes on his crazy career if he would like to see his twins grow up.

TMZ reports the 31-year-old was recently hospitalized after two blood clots were found in his lungs, as well as an enlarged ventricle on his heart. He Tweeted, "The Doctors found blood clots in my lungs and said if I don't slow down and stop working so hard then it's a wrap!"

The host will be stepping down from his job as the voice of "Rolling with Nick Cannon" show on New York’s 92.3, but before leaving, he took some time out to explain to fans what exactly was going on with his health. He said on the show, “It was quite serious. I was trying to downplay it a lot, even in my own mind."

Cannon, who also hosts television’s America's Got Talent, says that his travel schedule may have something to do with his health scares. “I travel a lot. Anyone who flies a lot can be a victim to getting blood clots because it can start in your legs or your lower back (from sitting for an extended period of time). That, on top of my previous condition made me more prone to (getting blood clots).”

“I couldn’t sleep because I was in so much pain. I was having a lot of pain in my back,” he added.

“My doctor was saying that my work is going to kill me – and he’s not joking,” he said Thursday. “I think part of the reason why my health did kind of deteriorate was because I wasn’t resting a lot and I was doing too much. I was overworking myself, working out too much.”

Despite his recent health scare, Cannon insisted that he's "feeling good" and "rejuvenated" and admited that he needs to cool it down before something more serious happens. “I always took a lot of pride in working so hard and never taking a day off,” he explained “But I’m learning that it isn’t the wisest thing all the time, especially being a new father. Not only wanting to spend more time with my children, but wanting to be there for my children.”

Cannon also added, "Even Superman has to sleep."

According to TMZ, Cannon will continue to host America's Got Talent along with his syndicated weekend radio show.
